intro: Aprevalia floribunda, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Aprevalia floribunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
